intro: Onobrychis marashensis var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine oxytropis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
